definitions.definition: To erase (as anything impressed or inscribed upon a surface); to render illegible or indiscernible .
examples: Do not efface what I've written on the chalkboard.

definitions.definition: To cause to disappear as if by rubbing out or striking out .
examples: Some people like to efface their own memories with alcohol.

definitions.definition: To make oneself inobtrusive as if due to modesty or diffidence .
examples: Many people seem shy, but they really just efface for meekness.

definitions.definition: Of the cervix during pregnancy , to thin and stretch in preparation for labor .
Of a woman: to have the cervix thin and stretch in this manner.
examples: Some females efface 75% by the 39th week of pregnancy.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To erase (as anything impressed or inscribed upon a surface); to render illegible or indiscernible .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To cause to disappear as if by rubbing out or striking out .
( intransitive ) To make oneself inobtrusive as if due to modesty or diffidence .
( medicine , intransitive ) Of the cervix during pregnancy , to thin and stretch in preparation for labor .
( medicine , intransitive ) Of a woman: to have the cervix thin and stretch in this manner.
